metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for an application as a Returning Resident

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for an application as a Returning Resident

1.   RR 1.1. A person applying as a Returning Resident must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form as follows: 
    1.   (a) Form “UKA/ROA/RR”; or
    2.   (b) for applicants under the Windrush Scheme, the “Windrush Scheme application (Overseas)” form. See Applying to the Windrush schemes from overseas guidance - GOV.UK ([www.gov.uk](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/applying-to-the-windrush-schemes-from-overseas/applying-to-the-windrush-schemes-from-overseas-guidance))

1.   RR 1.2. An application as a Returning Resident must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must be outside the UK; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have paid any required fee (no fee is required under the Windrush Scheme); and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must provide a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

1.   RR 1.3. DELETED

1.   RR 1.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a Returning Resident may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to individuals applying as Returning Residents. They must submit an online application from outside the UK, pay applicable fees (except under the Windrush Scheme), provide biometrics, and supply valid travel documents; failure to meet these conditions may result in rejection.

    2.   (b) for applicants under the Windrush Scheme, the “Windrush Scheme application (Overseas)” form. See Applying to the Windrush schemes from overseas guidance - GOV.UK ([www.gov.uk](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/applying-to-the-windrush-schemes-from-overseas/applying-to-the-windrush-schemes-from-overseas-guidance))

1.   RR 1.2. An application as a Returning Resident must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must be outside the UK; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have paid any required fee (no fee is required under the Windrush Scheme); and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    4.   (d) the applicant must provide a passport or other travel document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

1.   RR 1.3. DELETED

1.   RR 1.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a Returning Resident may be rejected as invalid and not considered.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for a Returning Resident

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.
chunks.summary: Returning Residents must meet suitability criteria, ensuring they are not refused under Part Suitability. They must satisfy applicable integrity and conduct standards without significant disqualifications.
chunks.augmented_text:

Topic: suitability

Summary: Returning Residents must meet suitability criteria, ensuring they are not refused under Part Suitability. They must satisfy applicable integrity and conduct standards without significant disqualifications.

### Suitability requirements for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 2.1. The applicant must not fall for refusal under Part Suitability.

metadata.section_id: Eligibility requirements for a Returning Resident
metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for a Returning Resident

chunks.text: ### Eligibility requirements for a Returning Resident
chunks.summary: This section applies to returning residents seeking to re-enter the UK. Applicants must demonstrate maintained long-term residence and good character, meeting specific residence thresholds unless exempt. Critical exceptions include cases of exceptional immigration or health grounds.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Returning Resident
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Returning Resident
Section ID: Eligibility requirements for a Returning Resident
Section: Eligibility requirements for a Returning Resident
Topic: eligibility

Summary: This section applies to returning residents seeking to re-enter the UK. Applicants must demonstrate maintained long-term residence and good character, meeting specific residence thresholds unless exempt. Critical exceptions include cases of exceptional immigration or health grounds.

### Eligibility requirements for a Returning Resident

metadata.section_title: Entry requirement for a Returning Resident

chunks.text:
### Entry requirement for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a Returning Resident must apply for and obtain an entry clearance as a Returning Resident before they arrive in the UK.

1.   RR 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a Returning Resident must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

1.   RR 3.3. A person applying for entry clearance must have previously been granted settlement in the UK which has lapsed by operation of law due to their absence from the UK.
chunks.summary: Returning Residents must obtain entry clearance before arrival, demonstrating prior settlement in the UK. Applicants subject to tuberculosis screening if applicable; re-entry depends on lawful settlement lapse due to absence.
chunks.augmented_text:

Section: Entry requirement for a Returning Resident
Topic: leave-to-enter

Summary: Returning Residents must obtain entry clearance before arrival, demonstrating prior settlement in the UK. Applicants subject to tuberculosis screening if applicable; re-entry depends on lawful settlement lapse due to absence.

### Entry requirement for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 3.1. A person seeking to come to the UK as a Returning Resident must apply for and obtain an entry clearance as a Returning Resident before they arrive in the UK.

1.   RR 3.2. A person applying for entry clearance as a Returning Resident must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.

1.   RR 3.3. A person applying for entry clearance must have previously been granted settlement in the UK which has lapsed by operation of law due to their absence from the UK.

metadata.section_title: Intention to settle requirement for a Returning Resident

chunks.text:
### Intention to settle requirement for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 4.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant genuinely intends to return to the UK for the purpose of settlement.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Returning Residents. It requires applicants to genuinely intend to settle in the UK upon return, with decision-makers verifying this intention; no specific exceptions are noted.
chunks.augmented_text:

### Intention to settle requirement for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 4.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant genuinely intends to return to the UK for the purpose of settlement.

metadata.section_title: Previous departure from UK requirement for a Returning Resident

chunks.text:
### Previous departure from UK requirement for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 5.1. Unless they are applying under the Windrush Scheme, the applicant must not have received assistance from public funds towards the cost of leaving the UK.
chunks.summary: Returning Residents must not have used public funds for departure unless applying under the Windrush Scheme; this restriction excludes those applying under the scheme.

Summary: Returning Residents must not have used public funds for departure unless applying under the Windrush Scheme; this restriction excludes those applying under the scheme.

### Previous departure from UK requirement for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 5.1. Unless they are applying under the Windrush Scheme, the applicant must not have received assistance from public funds towards the cost of leaving the UK.

metadata.section_title: Strong ties to the UK requirement for a Returning Resident

chunks.text:
### Strong ties to the UK requirement for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 6.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant has maintained strong ties to the UK during their absence from the UK.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Returning Residents. It requires applicants to demonstrate they maintained strong ties to the UK during their absence to qualify for entry. There are no specified thresholds, but the decision depends on the strength of the ties shown.
chunks.augmented_text:

Topic: eligibility

Summary: This provision applies to Returning Residents. It requires applicants to demonstrate they maintained strong ties to the UK during their absence to qualify for entry. There are no specified thresholds, but the decision depends on the strength of the ties shown.

### Strong ties to the UK requirement for a Returning Resident

1.   RR 6.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant has maintained strong ties to the UK during their absence from the UK.

metadata.section_title: Parental consent requirement for a Returning Resident aged under 18

chunks.text:
### Parental consent requirement for a Returning Resident aged under 18

RR 7.1. The applicant must meet the parental consent requirement for “applicant not applying as a dependent child” in Appendix Children.

RR 7.2. DELETED.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to returning residents under 18 seeking to re-enter the UK. They must obtain parental consent if not applying as a dependent child, as per Appendix Children; no exceptions are specified.

### Parental consent requirement for a Returning Resident aged under 18

RR 7.1. The applicant must meet the parental consent requirement for “applicant not applying as a dependent child” in Appendix Children.

RR 7.2. DELETED.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as a Returning Resident

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as a Returning Resident

1.   RR 8.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a Returning Resident are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.
2.   RR 8.2. If the application is refused, a request can be made for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: Returning Residents must meet suitability and eligibility criteria; applications meeting these are granted, others refused. Refusals can be challenged via Administrative Review.
chunks.augmented_text:
Document: Immigration Rules Appendix Returning Resident
Part: Immigration Rules Appendix Returning Resident

Section: Decision on an application as a Returning Resident
Topic: eligibility

Summary: Returning Residents must meet suitability and eligibility criteria; applications meeting these are granted, others refused. Refusals can be challenged via Administrative Review.

### Decision on an application as a Returning Resident

1.   RR 8.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for a Returning Resident are met, the application will be granted; otherwise, the application will be refused.
2.   RR 8.2. If the application is refused, a request can be made for an Administrative Review under Appendix AR: Administrative Review.

metadata.section_title: Period of grant as a Returning Resident

chunks.text:
### Period of grant as a Returning Resident

1.   RR 9.1. The applicant will be granted entry clearance for settlement.

Print this page
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Returning Residents seeking settlement. It permits entry clearance for settlement if eligibility conditions are met, without specifying additional conditions or thresholds.
